intro: Qiongzhuea puberula, commonly known as the hairy qiongzhuea, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and hairy foliage, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Qiongzhuea puberula is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
